title.narrative: Newton RCUK-SEA -- Capacity Building in STEM to ensure a sustainable community development and a successful astronomical observatory in Timor

description.narrative: The STEM education and outreach proposed by this project is aimed at strengthening engagement in local education, as well as specifically targeting teachers, by providing them with resources that can be used to underpin the STEM subjects taught in schools. Exposure to the practical applications of STEM and the opportunity to be involved in these directly is expected to encourage young people to pursue higher level education. Furthermore, to be acquainted with a team of real STEM experts will also be an encouraging experience for them. This early stage human capital development is expected to initiate increased economic development in the longer term.

We propose a STEM education project for young people as part of a community development work with the following objectives: 1. Understanding the general idea how the Earth system (including the Sun-Earth-Moon relation) works, the inter-relation of living beings including human and their dependence on Earth, the role of human in the whole ecosystem, and the modern idea of our place in the Universe. 2. Understanding how the various processes that control the availability of resource needed to support life, and the importance to develop ways to sustain this resources for as many future generations as possible 3. A sustainable environment for both the local community and the successful astronomical work to be carried out by planned astronomical facilities there
